info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN JACKSON AND EAST CENTRAL SWAIN COUNTIES UNTIL 345 PM EDT... At 322 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 5 miles northeast of Bryson City, or near Cherokee, moving north at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Cherokee, Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee and Whittier. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
